intro: Statice denudata, commonly known as the common statice, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many drought-tolerant species. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and sandy habitats. Statice denudata is widely cultivated as a garden ornamental due to its hardiness and ability to attract pollinators.
